history.proof: intros A B R op H x y H0. apply H. apply H0.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (A B : Type) (R : rel A A) (op : A -> B), (R ++> eq) op op -> forall x y : A, R x y -> op x = op y

Premises:
rel = fun A1 A2 : Type => A1 -> A2 -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments rel (_ _)%type_scope
Inductive eq (A : Type) (x : A) : A -> Prop := eq_refl : x = x Arguments eq {A}%type_scope Arguments eq_refl {A}%type_scope {x}, [A] _
Coreflexive = fun (A : Type) (R : relation A) => forall x y : A, R x y -> x = y : forall A : Type, relation A -> Prop Arguments Coreflexive {A}%type_scope _%rel_scope
rgraph_queue_sind : forall (A : Type) (R : rel A A) (m : A) (P : rgraph_queue R m -> SProp), P (rgraph_queue_nil R m) -> (forall (x : A) (r : forall y : A, R x y -> R m y) (r0 : rgraph_queue R m), P r0 -> P (rgraph_queue_cons R m x r r0)) -> forall r : rgraph_queue R m, P r
rgraph_queue_rect : forall (A : Type) (R : rel A A) (m : A) (P : rgraph_queue R m -> Type), P (rgraph_queue_nil R m) -> (forall (x : A) (r : forall y : A, R x y -> R m y) (r0 : rgraph_queue R m), P r0 -> P (rgraph_queue_cons R m x r r0)) -> forall r : rgraph_queue R m, P r
rgraph_queue_rec : forall (A : Type) (R : rel A A) (m : A) (P : rgraph_queue R m -> Set), P (rgraph_queue_nil R m) -> (forall (x : A) (r : forall y : A, R x y -> R m y) (r0 : rgraph_queue R m), P r0 -> P (rgraph_queue_cons R m x r r0)) -> forall r : rgraph_queue R m, P r
Inductive rgraph_queue (A : Type) (R : rel A A) (m : A) : Type := rgraph_queue_nil : rgraph_queue R m | rgraph_queue_cons : forall x : A, (forall y : A, R x y -> R m y) -> rgraph_queue R m -> rgraph_queue R m Arguments rgraph_queue {A}%type_scope _%rel_scope Arguments rgraph_queue_nil {A}%type_scope _%rel_scope Arguments rgraph_queue_cons {A}%type_scope _%rel_scope _ _ _%function_scope
subrel = fun (A B : Type) (R1 R2 : rel A B) => forall (x : A) (y : B), R1 x y -> R2 x y : forall A B : Type, rel (rel A B) (rel A B) Arguments subrel {A B}%type_scope (R1 R2)%rel_scope : rename
rel_all = fun (A B C : Type) (R : C -> rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => forall c : C, R c x y : forall A B C : Type, (C -> rel A B) -> rel A B Arguments rel_all {A B C}%type_scope _%function_scope
rdestruct_result = fun (A B : Type) (m : A) (n : B) (Q : rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => m = x /\ n = y -> Q x y : forall A B : Type, A -> B -> rel A B -> rel A B Arguments rdestruct_result {A B}%type_scope _ _ _%rel_scope
rel_impl = fun (A B : Type) (R1 R2 : rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => R1 x y -> R2 x y : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> rel A B -> rel A B Arguments rel_impl {A B}%type_scope (_ _)%rel_scope
rel_ex = fun (A B C : Type) (R : C -> rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => exists c : C, R c x y : forall A B C : Type, (C -> rel A B) -> rel A B Arguments rel_ex {A B C}%type_scope _%function_scope
RDestruct = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (T : rel A B -> Prop) => forall (m : A) (n : B), R m n -> forall P : rel A B, T P -> P m n : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> (rel A B -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments RDestruct {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope _%function_scope
RDecompose = fun (A B C : Type) (RAB : rel A B) (RBC : rel B C) (RAC : rel A C) => forall (x : A) (z : C), RAC x z -> exists y : B, (RAB x y /\ RBC y z)%type : forall A B C : Type, rel A B -> rel B C -> rel A C -> Prop Arguments RDecompose {A B C}%type_scope (_ _ _)%rel_scope
option_rel_some_inv : forall (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (x : option A) (y : option B) (a : A), option_rel R x y -> x = Some a -> exists b : B, (y = Some b /\ R a b)%type
RCompose = fun (A B C : Type) (RAB : rel A B) (RBC : rel B C) (RAC : rel A C) => forall (x : A) (y : B) (z : C), RAB x y -> RBC y z -> RAC x z : forall A B C : Type, rel A B -> rel B C -> rel A C -> Prop Arguments RCompose {A B C}%type_scope (_ _ _)%rel_scope
set_le = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (sA : A -> Prop) (sB : B -> Prop) => forall a : A, sA a -> exists b : B, (sB b /\ R a b)%type : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> rel (A -> Prop) (B -> Prop) Arguments set_le {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope
set_ge = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (sA : A -> Prop) (sB : B -> Prop) => forall b : B, sB b -> exists a : A, (sA a /\ R a b)%type : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> rel (A -> Prop) (B -> Prop) Arguments set_ge {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope
Convertible = fun (A : Type) (x y : A) => x = y : forall A : Type, A -> A -> Prop Arguments Convertible {A}%type_scope
rel_inter = fun (A B : Type) (R1 R2 : rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => (R1 x y /\ R2 x y)%type : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> rel A B -> rel A B Arguments rel_inter {A B} (_ _)%rel_scope
rel_union = fun (A B : Type) (R1 R2 : rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => (R1 x y \/ R2 x y)%type : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> rel A B -> rel A B Arguments rel_union {A B} (_ _)%rel_scope
rel_compose = fun (A B C : Type) (RAB : rel A B) (RBC : rel B C) (x : A) (z : C) => exists y : B, (RAB x y /\ RBC y z)%type : forall A B C : Type, rel A B -> rel B C -> rel A C Arguments rel_compose {A B C}%type_scope (_ _)%rel_scope
KLR.rel_kvd = fun (W A B : Type) (R : KLR.klr W A B) (x : A) (y : B) => forall w : W, R w x y : forall W A B : Type, KLR.klr W A B -> rel A B Arguments KLR.rel_kvd {W A B}%type_scope _%klr_scope
rintro = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (RIntro : RIntro P R m n) => RIntro : forall (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B), RIntro P R m n -> P -> R m n Arguments rintro {A B P}%type_scope {R}%rel_scope {m n RIntro}
set_ge_subrel = fun (A B : Type) (x y : rel A B) (H : subrel x y) (x0 : A -> Prop) (y0 : B -> Prop) (H0 : set_ge x x0 y0) (b : B) (H1 : y0 b) => (fun H2 : y0 b -> exists a : A, (x0 a /\ x a b)%type => (fun H3 : exists a : A, (x0 a /\ x a b)%type => ex_ind (fun (x1 : A) (H4 : x0 x1 /\ x x1 b) => and_ind (fun (H5 : x0 x1) (H6 : x x1 b) => ex_intro (fun a : A => (x0 a /\ y a b)%type) x1 (conj H5 ((fun _ : forall y1 : B, x x1 y1 -> y x1 y1 => H x1 b H6) (H x1)))) H4) H3) (H2 H1)) (H0 b) : forall A B :...
flip_subrel = fun (A B : Type) (x y : rel A B) (H : subrel x y) (x0 : B) (y0 : A) (H0 : flip x x0 y0) => (fun H1 : forall y1 : B, x y0 y1 -> y y0 y1 => (fun H2 : x y0 x0 -> y y0 x0 => (fun H3 : y y0 x0 => H3) (H2 H0)) (H1 x0)) (H y0) : forall A B : Type, Monotonic flip (subrel ++> subrel) Arguments flip_subrel {A B}%type_scope
Unnamed_thm4 : forall (A : Type) (a b : A) (R : rel A A), R a b -> let f := fun x y : A * A => (inr (fst x), inl (snd y)) in Monotonic f (R * ⊤ ++> ⊤ * R ++> (⊥ + R) * (R + ⊥))
KLR.klr_box = fun (L W : Type) (kf : KLR.KripkeFrame L W) (A B : Type) (l : L) (R : KLR.klr W A B) (w : W) (x : A) (y : B) => forall w' : W, KLR.acc l w w' -> R w' x y : forall L W : Type, KLR.KripkeFrame L W -> forall A B : Type, L -> KLR.klr W A B -> KLR.klr W A B Arguments KLR.klr_box {L W}%type_scope {kf} {A B}%type_scope _ _%klr_scope
rcompose_subrel = fun (A B C : Type) (RAB : rel A B) (RBC : rel B C) (RAC : rel A C) (H : RCompose RAB RBC RAC) (x : A) (y : C) (H0 : rel_compose RAB RBC x y) => ex_ind (fun (x0 : B) (H1 : RAB x x0 /\ RBC x0 y) => and_ind (fun (H2 : RAB x x0) (H3 : RBC x0 y) => (fun H4 : forall (y0 : B) (z : C), RAB x y0 -> RBC y0 z -> RAC x z => (fun H5 : forall z : C, RAB x x0 -> RBC x0 z -> RAC x z => (fun H6 : RAB x x0 -> RBC x0 y -> RAC x y => (fun H7 : RBC x0 y -> RAC x y => (fun H8 : RAC x y => H8) (H7 H3))...
rintro_rstep = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (H : RIntro P R m n) => H : forall (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B), RIntro P R m n -> RStep P (R m n) Arguments rintro_rstep {A B P}%type_scope {R}%rel_scope {m n}
rgraph_queue_cons : forall (R : rel ?A ?A) (m x : ?A), (forall y : ?A, R x y -> R m y) -> rgraph_queue R m -> rgraph_queue R m where ?A : [ |- Type]
Unnamed_thm2 : forall (A : Type) (a b : A) (R : rel A A) (f : A -> A) (p : A -> Prop), Monotonic f (R ++> R) -> Monotonic p (R --> impl) -> R a b -> p (f b) -> p (f a)
rgraph_done = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (a : A) (b : B) => R a b : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop Arguments rgraph_done {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope
Build_PolarityResolved : forall (A B : Type) (R : rel A B), PolarityResolved R
RIntro = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) => P -> R m n : forall A B : Type, Prop -> rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop Arguments RIntro {A B}%type_scope _%type_scope _%rel_scope
RExists = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) => P -> R m n : forall A B : Type, Prop -> rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop Arguments RExists {A B}%type_scope _%type_scope _%rel_scope
Related = fun (A B : Type) (f : A) (g : B) (R : rel A B) => R f g : forall A B : Type, A -> B -> rel A B -> Prop Arguments Related {A B}%type_scope _ _ _%rel_scope
lsat = fun (A B : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (_ : B) => P x : forall A B : Type, (A -> Prop) -> rel A B Arguments lsat {A B}%type_scope _%function_scope
rsat = fun (A B : Type) (P : B -> Prop) (_ : A) (y : B) => P y : forall A B : Type, (B -> Prop) -> rel A B Arguments rsat {A B}%type_scope _%function_scope
RElim = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (P Q : Prop) => R m n -> P -> Q : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop -> Prop -> Prop Arguments RElim {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope _ _ (_ _)%type_scope
Transport = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (a : A) (b : B) (PA PB : Prop) => R a b -> PA -> PB : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop -> Prop -> Prop Arguments Transport {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope _ _ (_ _)%type_scope
flip_context_candidate : forall (R : rel ?A ?B) (x : ?B) (y : ?A), R y x -> flip R x y where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type]

```  
intros A B R op H x y H0.
apply H.
exact H0.
```
